attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Since 1997 the government has spent half of its time criminalising everyday activities, those things which are deemed 'too complex a moral choice for the masses to make their own minds up about'. 
These are too numerous to list but well known examples include [paraphrased]:

The ban on using phones while driving.

The ban on hunting.

The ban on smoking in enclosed public spaces.

The ban on smacking children.

Selling a gamebird killed on a Sunday. [You think I'm joking, I'm really not...]

Etc.

Unfortunately, even if each of the new offences could be described in only 1 character, there would not be space for even a third of these new offences to be listed within this 1000 character body of text.
The government's paranoid and totalitarian law making has achieved nothing but a whole new level of disrespect for the government and rendered the police force utterly pointless. Most of the laws are designed to generate further funds and nothing more.

These 'laws' need striking from the record to allow REAL laws to be enforced properly and the honest majority of the population to be able to continue about their business without acquiring a criminal record.
